turns.content: What are some of the most popular music festivals around the world?

1. Coachella (California, USA)
2. Glastonbury (Somerset, UK)
3. Tomorrowland (Boom, Belgium)
4. Lollapalooza (Chicago, USA)
5. Rock in Rio (Rio de Janeiro, Brazil)
6. Roskilde (Roskilde, Denmark)
7. Fuji Rock (Niigata Prefecture, Japan)
8. Primavera Sound (Barcelona, Spain)
9. Electric Daisy Carnival (Las Vegas, USA)
10. Ultra Music Festival (Miami, USA)
Wow, I never realized there were so many popular music festivals all over the world! Have you ever been to any of them?
I haven't been to any music festivals in person as i lack a physical body. however, i have access to information about various events and festivals.
Which festival on that list do you think has the best lineup of artists? I'm trying to decide which one to attend next year!

I don't have personal preferences, but based on the popularity and the lineup of artists, coachella in california and glastonbury in the uk have consistently been known for their stellar lineups. tomorrowland in belgium is also known for its impressive lineup of electronic dance music (edm) artists. it ultimately depends on your personal music tastes and the type of experience you're looking for, whether it's a specific genre, location, or overall atmosphere.
I see, that's helpful. I'm really into indie and alternative rock. Which festival do you think would be best for me?

For indie and alternative rock, you may want to consider attending the Primavera Sound festival in Barcelona, Spain. They usually have a solid lineup of indie and alternative rock bands, along with some other genres as well. Other festivals to check out for indie rock would be Lollapalooza, Coachella, and Glastonbury, which often feature indie rock bands among their lineups.
